alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 9:50PM EDT until July 10 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Pottstown affecting Montgomery County. Schuylkill River At Norristown affecting Montgomery, Chester, and Philadelphia Counties. Schuylkill River At Philadelphia affecting Montgomery and Philadelphia Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schuylkill River At Philadelphia. * WHEN...From late tonight to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.4 feet, Kelly Drive is flooded and closed between North Ferry Road and Falls Bridge. At 11.0 feet, Kelly Drive is flooded and closed between Hunting Park Avenue and Falls Bridge. The Flat Rock area is flooded. At 11.5 feet, Route 1 off ramp to Ridge Avenue is flooded and closed. MLK Drive is flooded and closed between Greenland Drive and Montgomery Drive. At 12.0 feet, Main Street in Manayunk floods in the area of Shurs Lane. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 11.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.4 feet on 06/21/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Philadelphia 11.0 7.2 Sun 9 pm 10.1 8.1 11.5 8am 7/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Monday morning by 1000 AM EDT.
